item.title: Silent Hill: Townfall launches in 2026 for PS5, PC; reveal trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5

Fear the truth behind the static.

Silent Hill: Townfall will launch in 2026 for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store, publishers Konami and Annapurna Interactive, and developer Screen Burn Interactive announced.

Here are the latest details:

The new footage offers fans their first detailed look at this year’s entry in the iconic psychological-horror series. Developed by Screen Burn and co-published by Annapurna Interactive and Konami, Silent Hill: Townfall is a full-length, self-contained psychological horror set against the cold, isolated backdrop of Scotland. With the trailer’s debut, fans can now also wishlist Silent Hill: Townfall.

After its mysterious debut and teaser back in 2022, Silent Hill: Townfall storms back into the spotlight with chilling new revelations. The next chapter in the Silent Hill series aims to evolve the psychological horror from previous entries whilst also keeping themes synonymous with the franchise such as mystery, tragedy and loss.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Players take on the role of Simon Ordell who is called back to the island of St. Amelia to ‘put things right’, encountering a town lying quiet beneath a heavy fog, seemingly abandoned but not at rest. All he has on him besides his clothes are an IV bag and a medical wristband with his name on it. He heads to the town with no leads but the voices from the CRTV he picked up along the way. Venturing deeper and driven to understand his connection to the place and its inhabitants, Simon begins to discover fragments of a past rising to the surface.

Experienced entirely in first person, Simon must explore, evade, and survive using a limited set of weapons and tools, including the CRTV, a pocket television used to tune into unstable signals. Evasion is tense; combat is frenetic, while narrative driven puzzles reveal a truth that refuses to stay submerged.

Watch a new trailer and today’s Silent Hill Transmission below. View the first screenshots at the gallery. Visit the official website here.

Reveal Trailer

Japanese

Silent Hill Transmission: February 12, 2026

item.title: DEAD OR ALIVE New Project announced for PS5
item.content:encoded:
• PS5

The dawn of a new chapter awaits.

Publisher Koei Tecmo and developer Team NINJA have announced DEAD OR ALIVE New Project for PlayStation 5 (other platforms to be confirmed). A release date was not announced.

The new release celebrates the 30th anniversary of the series, which first launched in Japanese arcades on November 26, 1996.

Watch the teaser trailer below.

Teaser Trailer

Japanese

item.title: DEAD OR ALIVE 6 Last Round announced for PS5, Xbox Series, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Due out on June 25 alongside free-to-play version.

Publisher Koei Tecmo and developer Team NINJA have announced DEAD OR ALIVE 6 Last Round for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC (Steam). It will launch on June 25 for $39.99 / £32.99 / €39.99 / ¥6,380 alongside a free-to-play version called DEAD OR ALIVE 6 Last Round Core Fighters.

Here is an overview of the game, via Koei Tecmo:

DEAD OR ALIVE 6 Last Round is the definitive version of DEAD OR ALIVE 6, a title that shipped over 900,000 copies worldwide, with over eight million downloads of the free-to-play edition. Last Round features the original 24 characters alongside five characters from the game’s downloadable content lineup, including Nyotengu, Phase 4, Momiji, Rachel, and Tamaki. In addition, popular characters like Kasumi and Marie Rose will receive a total of five costumes based on other Team NINJA titles such as NINJA GAIDEN 3 Razor’s Edge and DEAD OR ALIVE Xtreme Venus Vacation. An all-new Photo Mode feature has also been added enabling players to capture every angle of their favorite fighters in action thanks to a full set of features including “character position” and “pose selection”!

DEAD OR ALIVE 6 Last Round has been updated for the latest hardware, while giving players the ability to carry over downloadable content costumes, premium tickets, and save data from the DEAD OR ALIVE 6 standard edition.

  • ❮
  • ❯

The free-to-play version, DEAD OR ALIVE 6 Last Round Core Fighters, is scheduled to release simultaneously alongside the standard edition. Kasumi, Marie Rose, Honoka, and NiCO will be available for use in the F2P version at launch. Photo Mode and online modes “DOA Quest” and “DOA Central” will also be playable.

Further updates, including new costumes and new characters are scheduled to be released post-launch across both the standard and free-to-play versions throughout the coming year. More details will be announced in the near future.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery. Visit the official website here.

Announce Trailer

Japanese
